quotes.quote: A prudent question is one half of wisdom.
No half measures. Some things can’t be cut in half. You can’t half love someone. You can’t half betray, or half lie.
Half of your power lies in your sameness with others. The other half lies in your uniqueness.
The wish for healing has always been half of health.
Remember, half the people you know are below average.
There is nothing so fatal to character as half finished tasks.
Remember, half the doctors in this country graduated in the bottom half of their class.
The judgment of the intellect is, at best, only the half of truth.
A half truth, like half a brick, is always more forcible as an argument than a whole one. It carries better.
Half the worry in the world is caused by people trying to make decisions before they have sufficient knowledge on which to base a decision.
The second half of the 20th Century is a complete flop.
If you had half as much brains as you have beard, you would have looked before you leaped.
Half the charm of climbing mountains is born in visions preceding this experience. Visions of what is mysterious, remote, inaccessible.
God Almighty never created a man half as wise as he looks.
One half of my life has put the other half in the grave.
A half-truth is usually less than half of that.
The firstÂ halfÂ ofÂ our lives are ruined by our parents and the secondÂ halfÂ by our children.
The first half of life is spent mainly in finding out who we are through seeing ourselves in our interaction with others.
Half the world does not know how the other half lives.
It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.
Half the battle is that people have to like you before you say one joke, one bit of humor.
One half of the world cannot understand the pleasures of the other.
Half our life is spent trying to find something to do with the time we have rushed through life trying to save.
Half a truth is better than no politics.
Half a truth is often a great lie.
Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
Half my life is an act of revision.
